Magic Pen is fine. We get easily accessible 15 Flat Pen from boots, Void Staff is still 35% _total_ MR, Abyssal is 15-25 reduction, we have Precision mastery, and we have Flat Pen Runes. Only Liandrie's is bad. Only _in comparison to_ Armor Pen is Magic Pen "garbage". Between 20 Flat on Youmuu's, 10 Flat on Duskblade, 10 Flat on Maw, 30% reduction from Cleaver, 50% _bonus_ Armor Pen, and then the runes/masteries bonuses. The fact that Armor Pen is so good is what creates the disparity between the two, rather than Magic Pen being bad.

a jinx with no armor pen with 6 items can still shred adcs. 

its more of a crit problem rather than armor pen

But armor gets much more itemization than MR. 

So it's like having two different scales.

You end up with tanks who build less MR, but there are also less Mpen items, so the three good MR items aren't nullified. AP also gets to become a larger number than AD.

Armor itemization is a lot more flexible, and you end up with tanks who have around 300 armor, so more armor pen is needed.

Armor items are just too good in comparison with MR items.


It's not that there's not enough M.pen or too much arm.pen, but more how the items arm. pen is tailored onto having much more flexibility than the m.pen items.

For example, Ap's "penetration item" is {{item:3135}} . M. pen, and some Ap. That's  it.

AD's "penetration item" has two build paths, with Lord Dominik's as well as Mortal Reminder. Lord Dominik's isn't THAT good, but the fact remains that they have a secondary option. Ads don't just get some penetration with dmg slapped onto it, but also an additional unique passive.

this is why {{item:3071}} needs to go back to a bruiser specific item.

the entire point of the thing was to be a core item for a very specific handful of fighters (and a situational pick for certain assassins), to give them some additional team synergy.

basically the idea was to give people an incentive to pick a bruiser who synergizes with cleaver over another champion against some teamcomps.

the fact that so many champions are stacking it with flat armor pen now, doesnt make the armor shred of cleaver in a game a rare case of a cleaver bruiser shredding armor for his team, but a common occurance, that everyone destroys everyone elses armor and deals almost true damage with 70 flat armor pen lategame.

Armor Pen is DEFINITELY the superior damage suplement, compared to crit.
Champions that can use it better than crit will opt for it, and champions that weren't viable due to poor crit interaction are now viable due to the power of pen. EVEN SIVIR is out of the meta now, despite her offering the same early pushing power and aoe speed utility that Karma is contested for. Sivir Karma SHOULD be a power lane in this meta, (She would be amazing in the popular comps like {{champion:85}} {{champion:2}} {{champion:8}} + {{champion:43}} ) but it isn't because Sivir doesn't function well with penetration. The only reason that Caitlyn is meta as a crit user is because of the armor avoidance on her headshots that she gets so many of now.
Ashe is gone, despite her ability (like jhin) to make picks for her team, because her crit reliance means she can't abuse armor pen.
Ezreal is only relevant as a non-pen builder due to his having the holy trinity of Poke, Mobility, and Utility ( {{item:3025}} ) that simply no other carry can bring to the table.

Well, a full ad team shouldn't be an instant lose. It is just plain dumb when a game gets decided in champion selection. You don't deserve a win cause you picked rammus or malphite against a full ad team.

>You don't deserve a win cause you picked rammus or malphite against a full ad team.

You kinda do, because it requires the enemy team to be dumb enough to draft full AD. There is such a thing as a draft so bad that you actually deserve to lose for it, when your team comp is Yas/Kha/Zed/Lucian you deserve to lose in champ select as long as the other teams comp isn't equally garbage.

What people mean when they say you shouldn't lose at champ select is that a single pick shouldn't lose you the game. You should be able to play any champ into any champ within reason, but of course if you draft 4 champs who are countered by a single stat you should basically lose on the spot, you did play badly since the draft is part of the game and decision making.

It has never been an instant loss.  Full AD teams are great at taking down objectives due to their high sustained damage and most have a strong early to mid-game period.

Generally, you had to snowball to win.
------------------
That aside, players can and will get punished horribly for choosing bad team compositions.

For example, if you pick a team without hard CC or durability, you deserve to get rolled by the enemy Katarina and Master Yi.

Nah, you could also say thornmail counters lifesteal.
Frankly, being a tank vs a full AD team is a huge advantage. You simply have 1 item more against their carries than usual. They also get forced to build ArPen ASAP instead of building lifesteal/crit. This means that your carries are way stronger against their carries as they don't have to rush ArPen.
That means: early game is sort of equal - midgame is in your favor - lategame is in your favor (as their tank has to build MR aswell).
It's certainly not a free win but it's a nice advantage. Unless, of course, they have a hard early/midgame comp and you picked some lategame teamfighters, in that case they might just snowball the game.

The problem I see is that there are many % armor pen items but only 1 % magic pen item.
Mages only have 4 flat pen (including {{item:3001}}) and 1 % pen.
AD champs have 3 flat pen items and 3 % pen items, one of which helps your entire team ({{item:3071}}).

This means that building Armor is less useful than building magic resist. Especially considering that AD has crit as well.

But ooohhh wait, AP champs can get upwards of 700 AP while AD champs get max around 500 or so.

Doesn't matter if you factor in all the modifiers. 
This includes for AD: Crit RNG, 2 % pen to counter tanks, 3 Flat pen for squishies and tanks, and 1 armor reducer that takes **30% of your armor away**
Meanwhile AP only gets: Massive amounts of AP, one % pen item, 2 flat pen items, and a Flat MR reducer of 10-25 (based on level).
